name: vulgarly
content:
vulgarly adverb
(UNSUITABLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not suitable, simple, or beautiful, or not in the style preferred by rich or well-educated people: "It can't have been her, can it?" said Constance, chewing crisps, vulgarly, with her mouth open. I made my own labels using some vulgarly bright pink fluorescent cardboard I had found.
More examplesFewer examplesThe walls are vulgarly painted with bands of red, green, and yellow."Now," he said, resting his elbows on the table rather vulgarly.We sneer at them for being vulgarly rich.

vulgarly adverb
(RUDELY)
in a way that is rude and likely to upset or anger people, especially by referring to sex or the body: When she asked him to do something, he told her vulgarly to get lost. His politics is at times self-righteous, the language vulgarly obscene. See
vulgar
More examplesFewer examplesThe woman in charge of the inn was vulgarly uncivil.They speak vulgarly and with no regard for the beauty of words.
